articles.title: A dual-band impedance transformer for frequency-dependent complex loads incorporating an L-type network
articles.authors: M Maktoomi, R Gupta, MS Hashmi

bib.title: A dual-band impedance transformer for frequency-dependent complex loads incorporating an L-type network
author: MA Maktoomi
R Gupta
bib.abstract: A novel scheme is presented to realize a matching network working at two arbitrary frequencies. The load is assumed to be complex as well as frequency dependent whereas the source-side impedance is real. There are two possible topologies of the proposed network, thereby being able to cater to a wider range of load impedances. In addition of being relatively miniaturized structures, closed form design equations are also achieved for these designs. Many examples are included to show working of the proposed scheme. A

articles.title: A Generalized Multi-Frequency Impedance Matching Technique
articles.authors: MA Maktoomi, R Gupta, MH Maktoomi, MS Hashmi

bib.title: A genaralized multi-frequency impedance matching technique
author: MA Maktoomi
R Gupta
MH Maktoomi
bib.abstract: This paper describes a generalized multi-frequency impedance transformer capable of providing concurrent matching at arbitrary number of frequencies. A frequency dependent complex load (FDCL) has been considered but the scheme is applicable for real loads as well. The exact analysis of the proposed design results in closed form equations with many independent free variables to cater to the wide range of FDCLs. The proposed theory is validated through a prototype fabricated on Rogers RO5880, with permittivity of 2.2, and

articles.title: High impedance transforming simplified Balun architecture in microstrip technology
articles.authors: R Gupta, M Hashmi

bib.title: High impedance transforming simplified Balun architecture in microstrip technology
author: R Gupta
M Hashmi
bib.abstract: In this article, a simplified balun structure inherently capable of providing high impedance transformation is proposed. The structure fulfills the requirements of a balun such as matching at all the ports, output ports phase difference of 180°, and isolation between output ports. The design is a symmetric network and is able to provide fully closed‐form design equations using the even‐odd mode analysis. The proposed systematic design approach also augments the overall design process. The presence of free variables in design

articles.title: A performance enhanced dual-band wireless power transfer system for practical ISM bands
articles.authors: K Dautov, R Gupta, M Hashmi

bib.title: A performance enhanced dual-band wireless power transfer system for practical ISM bands
author: K Dautov
R Gupta
M Hashmi
bib.abstract: This paper presents a dual-band wireless power transfer (WPT) system operating at industrial, scientific and medical (ISM) bands. The proposed WPT employs a defected ground structure (DGS) concept, therefore possesses an extremely small size of 18× 18 mm 2 circuit. At first, the design of a dual-band resonator is realized and then this is utilized to develop the dual-band WPT system. Then the proposed WPT is fabricated on Rogers RO4350B. The obtained measured results of 71% and 81% at the frequencies of 0.433 GHz

articles.title: Highly-efficient compact size DGS-based wireless power transfer for low-power sensor nodes
articles.authors: K Dautov, M Hashmi, S Verma, R Gupta
articles.publication: 2019 IEEE MTT-S International Microwave and RF Conference (IMARC), 1-4, 2019

bib.title: Highly-efficient compact size DGS-based wireless power transfer for low-power sensor nodes
author: K Dautov
M Hashmi
S Verma
bib.abstract: This paper presents the design of a highly-efficient plus-shaped defected ground structure (DGS) based wireless power transfer (WPT) system that is applicable for low-power electronic devices. The prototype, developed on RO4350B op-erates at 0.4 GHz and occupies a board area of 30× 30 mm 2. The proposed WPT system advances the existing state-of-the-art by exhibiting significantly superior figures of merit (FoM). In particular, it possesses a constant efficiency of 86% between 20 mm and 35 mm around the industrial

articles.title: Tipranavir/T20-based salvage regimens highly effective and durable against HIV-1 with evidence for genotypic predictability of response in clinical practice
articles.authors: RK Gupta, C Loveday, U Kalidindi, M Lechelt, C Skinner, C Orkin

bib.title: Tipranavir/T20-based salvage regimens highly effective and durable against HIV-1 with evidence for genotypic predictability of response in clinical practice
author: RK Gupta
C Loveday
U Kalidindi
bib.abstract: Escalating drug resistance in treatment-experienced HIV-1-infected patients has made management increasingly difficult. In clinical trials, tipranavir (TPV) has produced potent and durable responses in such patients, although experience in clinical cohorts is limited. A retrospective clinical case review was undertaken of triple-class experienced HIV-1-infected patients receiving optimized boosted TPV-containing regimens and T20 with up to 108 weeks follow-up. Antiretroviral therapy (ART) resistance profiles were characterized using

articles.title: An enhanced frequency ratio dual band balun augmented with high impedance transformation
articles.authors: R Gupta, MS Hashmi, MH Maktoomi
articles.publication: IEEE Transactions on Circuits and Systems II: Express Briefs 67 (12), 2973-2977, 2020

bib.title: An enhanced frequency ratio dual band balun augmented with high impedance transformation
author: R Gupta
MS Hashmi
bib.abstract: Design of a dual-band balun achieving simultaneous high impedance ratio (> 20) and band-ratio (> 10) is reported in this brief. The presented design, augmented with closed-form design equations and a systematic design procedure, achieves excellent isolation between output ports and good matching at all the ports. A number of case studies are included to demonstrate the capability of the presented approach for varying design specifications and port-terminations. A prototype is developed for impedance transformation ratio (k) of 5 and

articles.title: Self-crowding of AMPA receptors in the excitatory postsynaptic density can effectuate anomalous receptor sub-diffusion
articles.authors: R Gupta

bib.title: Self-crowding of AMPA receptors in the excitatory postsynaptic density can effectuate anomalous receptor sub-diffusion
author: R Gupta
bib.abstract: AMPA receptors (AMPARs) and their associations with auxiliary transmembrane proteins are bulky structures with large steric-exclusion volumes. Hence, self-crowding of AMPARs, depending on the local density, may affect their lateral diffusion in the postsynaptic membrane as well as in the highly crowded postsynaptic density (PSD) at excitatory synapses. Earlier theoretical studies considered only the roles of transmembrane obstacles and the AMPAR-binding submembranous scaffold proteins in shaping receptor diffusion

articles.title: High Impedance Transforming Dual-band Balun with Isolation and Output Ports Matching
articles.authors: R Gupta
articles.publication: Journal of Progress in Electromagnetics Research, 2019

bib.title: High impedance transforming dual-band balun with isolation and output ports matching
author: R Gupta
M Maktoomi
VV Singh
MS Hashmi
bib.abstract: A dual-band balun with inherent impedance transformation is presented in this paper. The inherent impedance transformation ratio from a range of 0.4 to 4.0 makes the balun ideal for the on-chip fabrication. The proposed dual-band balun exhibits excellent input port matching, equal output signal with phase di erence of 180, and extremely good isolation and matching at the output ports. A table is provided with the design parameters at the extreme impedance transformation ratios. The design concept of the proposed balun has been

articles.title: An high impedance transformation ratio dual-band matching network with DC isolation capability
articles.authors: R Gupta, A Saxena, MA Maktoomi, MS Hashmi

bib.title: An high impedance transformation ratio dual-band matching network with DC isolation capability
author: R Gupta
A Saxena
MA Maktoomi
bib.abstract: A new dual-band impedance matching network for high transformation ratio and with inherent DC isolation capability is presented in this paper. The reported design utilizes two-section transmission line, a coupled-line section, and a stub for dual-band matching between a real-load and source impedances at two arbitrarily chosen frequencies. A closed form design equations aongwith a number of case studies have been provided to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed design scheme for very wide range of

articles.title: Wideband phase shifter with stub loaded transmission line
articles.authors: A Ahlawat, R Gupta, MS Hashmi

bib.title: Wideband phase shifter with stub loaded transmission line
author: A Ahlawat
R Gupta
MS Hashmi
bib.abstract: This paper presents a modified architecture for a wide band phase shifter. The proposed design consists of a main line with a T-network and a modified conventional reference line with an L-network. For quick prototyping, the design examples are demonstrated to work for several phase shifts upto 90° for a wide bandwidth. To verify the given design procedure, a 90° phase shifter, working at 1.8 GHz, is prototyped on Rogers5880 with substrate thickness of 1.575 mm and dielectric constant of 2.2. The prototype is able to provide the 90° phase

articles.title: Stochastic mesocortical dynamics and robustness of working memory during delay-period
articles.authors: M Reneaux, R Gupta

bib.title: Stochastic mesocortical dynamics and robustness of working memory during delay-period
author: M Reneaux
R Gupta
bib.abstract: The role of prefronto-mesoprefrontal system in the dopaminergic modulation of working memory during delayed response tasks is well-known. Recently, a dynamical model of the closed-loop mesocortical circuit has been proposed which employs a deterministic framework to elucidate the system's behavior in a qualitative manner. Under natural conditions, noise emanating from various sources affects the circuit's functioning to a great extent. Accordingly in the present study, we reformulate the model into a stochastic

articles.title: Flexible design scheme for a simple dual-band ultra-high impedance transformer and its application in a balun
articles.authors: R Gupta, MS Hashmi, MA Chaudhary

bib.title: Flexible design scheme for a simple dual-band ultra-high impedance transformer and its application in a balun
author: R Gupta
MS Hashmi
MA Chaudhary
bib.abstract: A dual-band impedance transformer for achieving very high impedance transformation (k) and frequency ratio (r) is presented in this paper. The design is accompanied by a thorough analysis and systematic design procedure for facilitating the rapid development of the prototypes. A number of case studies show the excellent design flexibility of the proposed design in regards to achieving ultra-high k and r. Two prototypes, with very high design specifications, working at concurrent r= 5, k= 8.04 and r= 15, k= 20 are fabricated to validate

articles.title: Design of π-Structure Dual-Band Matching Network With Unequal Susceptance Cancellation Stubs
articles.authors: A Saxena, D Banerjee, R Gupta, M Hashmi
articles.publication: 2018 IEEE MTT-S International Microwave and RF Conference (IMaRC), 1-3, 2018

bib.title: Design of π-Structure Dual-Band Matching Network With Unequal Susceptance Cancellation Stubs
author: A Saxena
D Banerjee
R Gupta
bib.abstract: This paper proposes a novel design of a dual-band impedance matching network using unequal susceptance cancellation. It derives and illustrates the interesting property of a stub to cancel unequal susceptances, irrespective of the sign, at any two arbitrary frequencies of interest. This increases design flexibility and ease. To validate the presented theory, a prototype operating at 1.0 GHz and 1.8 GHz, has been fabricated on RO5880 (ε r= 2.2). The measured results are in good agreement with the simulated ones.

articles.title: Prefronto-cortical dopamine D1 receptor sensitivity can critically influence working memory maintenance during delayed response tasks
articles.authors: M Reneaux, R Gupta

bib.title: Prefronto-cortical dopamine D1 receptor sensitivity can critically influence working memory maintenance during delayed response tasks
author: M Reneaux
R Gupta
bib.abstract: The dopamine (DA) hypothesis of cognitive deficits suggests that too low or too high extracellular DA concentration in the prefrontal cortex (PFC) can severely impair the working memory (WM) maintenance during delay period. Thus, there exists only an optimal range of DA where the sustained-firing activity, the neural correlate of WM maintenance, in the cortex possesses optimal firing frequency as well as robustness against noisy distractions. Empirical evidences demonstrate changes even in the D1 receptor (D1R)-sensitivity to

articles.title: A novel wideband phase shifter using T-and Pi-networks
articles.authors: M Maktoomi, R Gupta, MA Maktoomi, MS Hashmi

bib.title: A novel wideband phase shifter using T-and Pi-networks
author: M Maktoomi
R Gupta
MA Maktoomi
bib.abstract: In this paper, a wideband differential phase shifter based on modified T-and Pi-networks is proposed. Invoking the even-odd mode analysis in this symmetric phase shifter, closed-form equations of its S-parameters are derived. The derived equations enable a generic design scheme of the phase shifter, that is, ideally the phase shifter can be designed for any differential phase requirements. To illustrate the proposed idea, design parameters for differential phases of 45, 60, 75, 90, 105 and 120 are evaluated and tabulated considering a

articles.title: Role of heterogeneous macromolecular crowding and geometrical irregularity at central excitatory synapses in shaping synaptic transmission
articles.authors: R Gupta, M Reneaux

bib.title: Role of heterogeneous macromolecular crowding and geometrical irregularity at central excitatory synapses in shaping synaptic transmission
author: R Gupta
M Reneaux
bib.abstract: Besides the geometrical tortousity due to the extrasynaptic structures, macromolecular crowding and geometrical irregularities constituting the cleft composition at central excitatory synapses has a major and direct role in retarding the glutamate diffusion within the cleft space. However, the cleft composition may not only coarsely reduce the overall diffusivity of the glutamate but may also lead to substantial spatial variation in the diffusivity across the cleft space. Decrease in the overall diffusivity of the glutamate may have straightforward

articles.title: A New High Frequency Balun with Simplified Impedance Matching Technique
articles.authors: R Gupta, MA Maktoomi, MS Hashmi

bib.title: A new high frequency balun with simplified impedance matching technique
author: R Gupta
MA Maktoomi
bib.abstract: In this paper, a high frequency balun with a very simple and intuitive impedance matching procedure is presented. Owing to the presence of symmetry in the proposed structure, the even-odd mode analysis is applied which results into closed-form design equations. Since, the proposed design has many variables that can be chosen independently, the design equations are investigated to assess the limitation of the choice of different variables. Based on the proposed theory, a balun has been designed for operation at 2GHz and implemented

bib.title: Development and Thorough Investigation of Dual-Band Wilkinson Power Divider for Arbitrary Impedance Environment
author: R Gupta
B Gabdrakhimov
A Dabarov
bib.abstract: In the design and development of front-end communication systems, the arbitrary impedance environments are encountered frequently. In this article, a three-port dual-band equal power divider is proposed which also transforms all types of impedance environments at its ports inherently. The power divider is suitable for a wide range of arbitrary frequency ratios and impedance terminations at each of the input and output ports. A systematic design procedure with a design flow graph is provided. The closed-form design equations make the

articles.title: Dual-Frequency Impedance Transformer with Ultra-High Impedance Transformation
articles.authors: R Gupta, O Shaikenov, S Kairatova, K Dautov, M Hashmi

bib.title: Dual-Frequency Impedance Transformer with Ultra-High Impedance Transformation
author: R Gupta
O Shaikenov
S Kairatova
bib.abstract: A new dual-band impedance transformer with ultrahigh impedance transformation ratio (UHITR) at the two uncorrelated frequencies is proposed in this paper. The impedance transformer is equipped with two open/short shunt stubs which enhance the impedance transformation capability. The analytical expressions make it quick to design and then the presented design cases with ultrahigh impedance transformation demonstrate the easy microstrip line realization of the prototype. Finally, the proposed technique has been

articles.title: An Ordering Policy for Deteriorating Items with Time-Dependent Quadratic Demand and Salvage Value under Permissible Delay in Payment

author: T Singh
MM Muduly
C Mallick
RK Gupta
bib.abstract: The article deals with an economic order quantity (EOQ) inventory model for deteriorating items in which the supplier provides the purchaser a permissible delay in payment. This is so when deterioration of units in the inventory is subject to constant deterioration rate, demand rate is quadratic function of time and salvage value is associated with the deteriorated units. Shortages in the system are not allowed to occur. A mathematical formulation is developed when the supplier offers a permissible delay period to the

articles.title: High Impedance Transforming Dual-Band Wilkinson Power Divider

bib.title: High Impedance Transforming Dual-Band Wilkinson Power Divider
author: R Gupta
VV Singh
MS Hashmi
bib.abstract: A dual-band Wilkinson Power Divider (WPD) with inherent impedance transformation is proposed in this paper. The stepwise design procedure is written to compute the design parameters analytically. The design examples are provided at arbitrarily chosen frequency ratios and impedance ratios. The proposed design supports excellent impedance transformation for Impedance Transformation Ratios (ITR) ranging from 0.1 to 50.0 and beyond. To validate the proposed concept, a prototype working at 1.8 GHz/3.6 GHz, is

articles.title: Dual-Band Wilkinson Power Divider with Port Extensions
articles.authors: R Gupta, MA Maktoomi, MS Hashmi

bib.title: Dual-Band Wilkinson Power Divider with Port Extensions
author: R Gupta
MA Maktoomi
bib.abstract: This paper reports a coupled-line based dual-band Wilkinson Power Divider (WPD) with two-section transmission lines (TSTL) at all its ports. The design utilizes only one resistor as a frequency independent isolation element. The design offers its operation with good bandwidth and wide band-ratio (= f 2/f 1) at the two distant arbitrary frequencies. The design equations are provided to compute the design parameters. Three design examples are also tabulated in the paper with stepwise design procedure. The measurement of the fabricated

articles.title: Symmetric tri-band balun architecture with a systematic design procedure
articles.authors: R Gupta, AP Yadav, MS Hashmi

bib.title: Symmetric tri-band balun architecture with a systematic design procedure
author: R Gupta
AP Yadav
MS Hashmi
bib.abstract: A new structure for a passive tri-band balun, operating at three arbitrary frequencies, is presented in this paper. The proposed technique makes effective use of the existing dual-band balun. The resulting architecture is symmetric and enables simple even-and odd-mode analysis to simplify the design equations. The simplified analysis leads to closed form equations with two free design variables. The presence of free design variables provide the opportunity to develop a simplified systematic design procedure for wide range of

articles.title: Prediction of Research Trends using LDA based Topic Modeling

author: RK Gupta
R Agarwalla
BH Naik
JR Evuri
bib.abstract: Change is the only constant. In many sectors, a change is being witnessed that is getting increasingly rapid. This carries a plethora of new innovation possibilities with it. This necessitates well-founded data about trends, future developments and their consequences. This study seeks to catch the new directions, paradigms as predictors with an association of each topic which will be discovered through topic modeling techniques like LDA with BoW. For this, empirical analysis on 3269 research articles from the Journal of Applied Intelligence

bib.abstract: Intrusions (or threats) have been considerably increased due to the rapid growth in Internet and network technologies. Nowadays, the world is moving more toward a digital world in this era of networks; it makes more vulnerable to attacks. Intrusion detection models have proved to be a robust method in achieving high security in the network. The detection capacity of the intrusion detection model depends on the training set. High-dimensional dataset increases complexities, higher resource utilization, and affects system accuracy. Many researchers

articles.title: Highly Flexible Uniplanar Dual-Band Power Divider for Arbitrary Source and Load Impedances

bib.title: Highly Flexible Uniplanar Dual-Band Power Divider for Arbitrary Source and Load Impedances
author: R Gupta
M Assaad
M Hashmi
bib.abstract: In this paper, a dual-band impedance transforming power divider is investigated for all types of impedance environments at its ports, irrespective of the locations of the ports. The intuitive design approach utilizes conventional single-band Wilkinson Power Divider (WPD) architecture to provide superior dual-band performance with arbitrary port impedances. The proposed power divider also accords a high degree of design flexibility with high frequency ratios (r) and impedance transformation ratios (k). The presented concept is evaluated and

articles.title: A Dual-Band Balun Architecture With Unequal Port-Terminations

bib.title: A Dual-Band Balun Architecture With Unequal Port-Terminations
author: R Gupta
S Kairatova
M Hashmi
bib.abstract: A dual-band balun capable of providing inherent impedance transformation required for unequal terminations at the balanced and unbalanced ports is proposed in this paper. A systematic design analysis of the proposed balun is carried out to provide closed-form design equations for quick prototyping. Design cases are included to demonstrate the effectiveness of the developed design procedure. The proposed balun is capable of achieving a high frequency ratio (1.6< r< 5.0) and high impedance ratio (1< k< 10). A

author: R Gupta
MS Hashmi
bib.abstract: The burgeoning of a multi-standard wireless communication system (WCS) with the multitude of emerging applications has been permeating the design and development of radio frequency (RF) circuits and components of the front-end subsystem. To support multiple standards, the design and development of the multi-band RF and Microwave circuits and components are highly desirable. This is due to the fact that these wireless standards are operating at multiple frequencies, and therefore, the multi-band architectures

articles.title: Dual-Frequency Out-Of-Phase Power Divider with Integrated Impedance Transformation
articles.authors: R Gupta, MA Chaudhary, MS Hashmi

bib.title: Dual-Frequency Out-Of-Phase Power Divider with Integrated Impedance Transformation
author: R Gupta
MA Chaudhary
bib.abstract: Design of a dual-band out-of-phase power divider (PD) exhibiting inherent impedance transformation at arbitrary frequency ratios is presented in this paper. The proposed PD is augmented with an effective design strategy to obtain wide band-ratios and wide impedance ratios, concurrently. The analytical design procedure is obtained using classical even-odd mode approach. The proposed design is validated through a prototype on Rogers RO5880 substrate. An excellent agreement between the EM simulation and measurement results is a

S Rajavel
T Singh
SM Singh
bib.abstract: Elder abuse is a single or repeated act or lack of appropriate action, occurring within any relationship where there is an expectation of trust which causes harm or distress to an older person. The abuse can be in the form of verbal, psychological, physical, financial, neglect or sexual that can lead to serious physical injuries and long-term psychological consequences. The objective of the study was to estimate the prevalence of vulnerability of the elderly to abuse during the COVID-19 pandemic in an urban slum which is the field practice are of

bib.title: A Power Divider Utilizing Stepped Impedance Transformers for Real/Complex Port Terminations
author: R Gupta
VV Singh
M Hashmi
bib.abstract: A novel power divider architecture is proposed in this paper to provide inherent impedance transformation. The power divider provides inherent impedance transformation for either real or complex port impedances. The proposed architecture makes use of the stepped impedance transformers to support high impedance transformations. The presented technique is supported by a thorough design analysis and is augmented with a number of design cases to demonstrate the effectiveness of the presented approach. A prototype

bib.abstract: Seagrass plays an important role in maintaining the sea ecosystem. Seagrass provide habitats for fish and invertebrates, provides food, purifies water, stabilize sediment so its sustainability needs to be maintained. Due to human activities like sewage input, dumping of solid waste on the shoreline and anchoring of boats, the population of seagrass has been decreasing continuously which has led to instability in the marine ecosystem. Maping and classifying the seagrass from the remote place and from satellite image is very complex task
